title: 4 Day Tropical Holistic Yoga Holiday San Juan del Sur, Nicaragua
description: Check out the 4 Day Tropical Holistic Yoga Holiday San Juan del Sur, Nicaragua. Browse Photos, read reviews and Reserve your spot now at BookRetreats.
cleaned_text: by any number of days* This retreat offers you to adapt a healthy lifestyle while you are on a tropical holiday in paradise. You are able to immerse yourself in the practice and wisdom of yoga with dreamy views overlooking the ocean. Styles Skill Level Food FREE Gifts (if you book with BookRetreats.com) Imagine waking up to the sounds of the jungle, knowing you are going to start off your day just right. Your yoga teacher will take you through an energized morning flow, where you will wake up the body and quiet the mind. A multi course healthy and delicious breakfast awaits and the Eden team is ready to help you plan your day. - The ideal place to unplug, slow down, and get back in touch with yourself - Peace and quiet for the mind, refreshing energy for the body - A gorgeous place to have a relaxing break from daily life - Restore your mind, body, and soul - A relaxing holiday in a beautiful location - A model for living a healthy lifestyle with food, exercise, and a calm mind This retreat gives you the freedom to be able to explore and reset at the same time. We aim to inspire EVERYONE who sets foot at Eden to live a happier, healthier and a more conscious life. This includes all of our guests, visitors and staff members. See below for a typical day of your retreat. The way we fuel our bodies is one of the most important focuses of the retreat. All of our meals have the following ingredients: - It's honest. We are conscious of where our food is coming from. Our food is locally sourced and some even come out of our own garden. [Kelly de Beer](/teacher/kelly-de-beer) After giving up a life as a tax advisor in Amsterdam, Kelly traveled the world with Remy to search for something more in life. She had no idea what she was looking for. A yoga teacher training, a Reiki training, and a Vipassana meditation course helped her find happiness by just being. [Monika Staszczyk](/teacher/monika-staszczyk) Monika is sun-loving, traveling yoga teacher. She is a 300 RYT yoga teacher specialized in Vinyasa, Yin Yoga and Yoga Nidra and a Pilates instructor. Her love for movement started at a young age as she began attending dancing classes. Yoga appeared in her life when she needed aid that helped her recover, physically and mentally. [Remy Groenendaal](/teacher/remy-groenendaal) Remy, from The Netherlands, decided he wanted a change in his life. The interest of becoming a better version of himself and living a healthy lifestyle was always a big part of his life since his professional tennis career. Private Bungalow for 2p (book for 2p, price is pp)€326€266 *Two people required to reserve - The price is pp* With this accommodation, you book a bungalow just for you two. Your bungalow has its own kingsize bed (or can be seperated in to 2 twin beds), mosquito net, fan, private bathroom and balcony with a Nica-style hammock and amazing ocean or jungle views! Shared bungalow (shared with max 2 others)€397€350 With this accommodation, you book a shared bungalow. You will stay in a bungalow with max 2 other persons. The price is for 1 person. Private Bungalow for 1€466€419With this accommodation, you book a bungalow just for yourself. The price is for 1 person. Your cabana has its own kingsize bed, mosquito net, fan, private bathroom and balcony with a Nica-style hammock and amazing ocean or jungle views. This retreat center is located in a beautiful tropical garden with stunning views overlooking the jungle and ocean. The look-out bay is a 15-minute walk. It's a beautiful beach to walk around and relax. It has a restaurant and pool as well. Another beautiful pristine beach is a 20-minute walk through nature, a beach hardly anyone knows about. A beautiful beach to go for a swim. The colorful San Juan del Sur is a 10-minute drive or a 30-minute walk from the retreat center. [Eden on the Chocolata](/center/eden-on-the-chocolata) Eden on the Chocolata is an eco-lodge in a beautiful garden on the road named La Chocolata. Our luxury cabanas have been built to give you the experience of living among nature without compromising on your comforts. Eden will be your home away from home where you can get into the habit of doing everyday yoga, being active, eating healthy, taking the time to wind down, relaxing and making new friends over family-style dinners. Interested in this retreat? - Unlimited use of WiFi, swimming pool, yoga space and outdoor gym - 2 daily yoga sessions (Vinyasa, Yin, and meditation) - 2 daily delicious nourishing vegetarian meals: breakfast and 3-course dinner - 3 nights eco-luxury accommodation - Unlimited coffee, tea and filtered water - A loving team who helps you plan your day - Additional (optional) activities or excursions - Airfares - Transport, but we can help to arrange it - Gratuities - Lunch Seasonal information We are lucky in enough we have a tropical sunny climate yearround. Although weather can't be predicted there are considered two seasons in Nicaragua. May - October: Green season. Tropical rain showers at night, clear and sunny during the day. Weather information We are coming out of the rainy season and into the dry season. The temperatures are 75-90. It is warm and beautiful with plenty of sun and maybe some rain. Responsible travel Say 'Hola, como estas'? to the locals. They will appreciate it. We can organize some cultural trips. For example, a day trip to Granada where you can experience the Nicaraguan architecture and the local life. Electricity and outlets We try to thread the environment lightly. For that reason, we are running on solar power. How to get there (flights, airport transfers, buses, trains) Please book your flight to arrive at Augusto C. Sandino International Airport (MGA) in Managua, Nicaragua. From here, we can arrange a taxi for 90 USD (one way) to Eden. It is also possible to book your flight to Guanacaste Airport, before known as Daniel Oduber Quirós International Airport (LIR), in Liberia, Costa Rica and you will have to cross the border to Nicaragua. Visa stuff All passports must have at least six months left on them before they expire. What to bring - Sunscreen - Flip flops - Comfortable clothes for yoga - Mosquito spray - Sunglasses - Small bills, either cordobas or dollars. (A lot of stores or taxi drivers don't have change) - A journal - An open mind Vaccinations requirements Yellow fever vaccination certificate required for travellers aged 1 year or over arriving from countries with risk of yellow fever transmission. What are the options for lunch? We have a health bar where you can order healthy snacks and lunch. Every day we offer a different salad of the day, served with fresh coconut water. Other options are smoothies, energy balls, smoothiebowls, toasts etc. In which currency can I pay in Nicaragua? You can pay in Nicaraguan Cordobas or US Dollars. The bigger restaurants will accept creditcard. The small local shops only accept cash. Do I need to bring a yoga mat? We will provide all the yoga mats, but if you prefer to have your own yoga mat, you can bring it of course. Is there free time in between the yoga class? Yes, most of the days you have free time in between 10am and 4pm to relax or do different activities. Activities at the lodge: - massage - reiki (throughout most of the year) - pedicure - manicure - workshops Activities nearby: - surf class - horseback riding - catamaran tour - beach hikes - town trips - ziplining - guided tour to Granada, Masaya active volcano, Laguna de Apoyo What transport can I take to go to Eden? We can set up a taxi for you for 90 US dollars from Managua airport to Eden and it will take around 2.5 - 3 hours. Or you can take a shuttle which you can book through Iskra Travel, Caribe shuttle or Casa Oro. Local transport is around 10 dollars, but is less convenient and it will take around 4 hours. If you come from Liberia, Costa Rica, we can set up a taxi for 160 dollars. Note that transportation needs to be paid when the booking is made and is non refundable. Can I share a taxi with another guest? If there are arriving several guests at the same time at Managua airport, we will try to combine the taxi with several guests. Can I book extra nights at Eden? Yes, you can. Just send a us a message for availability and prices. Is there free WiFi? Yes, we have free fiber optic wifi in all the bungalows and in the main area and the swimming pool area. Is the retreat for beginners or intermediate? Everybody is welcome on this retreat. The retreat is perfect for beginners and intermediate. We will offer different classes which are suitable for everybody. Are there surf beaches nearby? Yes, there are several beaches nearby for surf. There are waves all year around. How is the weather in San Juan del Sur? It is always warm and sunny. The rainy season is from mid-May until the end of October. We rather call it the green season, it's the most beautiful time of year and it mostly rains during the night. From November until April it is the dry season with a lot of sun. In November and December, nature is still green from the rain season. After that, nature will be more dry. How can I pay when I check-in / check-out from the retreat center? You can pay in cash in Cordobas or US Dollar. You can also pay by credit card or paypal (with a surcharge of 4%). Do you offer bike- or motorbike-rental? We offer motorbikes for 15 dollar per day. How do I get from the airport to your location? From Augusto C. Sandino International Airport (MGA) in Managua, Nicaragua, it will take about 2.5 to reach us by car. A taxi from Managua to us is 90 US dollar one way. Local buses are around 10 dollars and shuttles 30-40 dollars.
